alert.note: Alert for Coastal St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 5:41PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern St. Lucie County through 615 PM EDT... At 541 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fort Pierce, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Pierce, White City, Saint Lucie Nuclear Power Plant, Fort Pierce Inlet, and Indian River Estates. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
